subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Carlos Moyá won his fifth Croatia Open title yesterday, defeating Andrei Pavel of Romania, 6-4, 6-2, in Umag.Moyá, who also won in 1996, 2001, 2002 and 2003, has a 43-8 record in the tournament. Moyá, seeded sixth, made several forehand errors in the first set, with Pavel serving well until 4-4. Then Moyá broke to 5-4, but needed to use his eighth set point to win the longest game of the match. In the second set, Moyá broke in the fifth game.
